name: src/event-queue.js
Signal
description: A wrapper class. It is used to raise errors and signal interruptions to normal iteration flow.

params.name: err
params.description: an error to be trhown during iteration

name: err
description: an error object to be held

name: Iterator
description: Class implements JS asyncIterator protocol to be used in `for-await-of loop`

name: next
description:
returns the result with two optional data members: `value` must be returned if there is more data expected.
`done` must be set to true when iteration is finished, in this case `value` is ignored

name: [Symbol.asyncIterator]
description: Support for `for-await-of loop` using iterator object

name: EventQueue
description: Event queue with support for `async-await` reading by a single consumer

name: end
description: Getter for the end marker. This object is sent when queue is shutdown

name: receive
description:
Async method that can be waited on to receive the next message.
At most one consumer at a time is expected to be waiting.
The method throws an exception after queue was shut down and all pendingmessages were delivered.

name: send
description:
Sends a message to a waiting consumer, or stores it in-memory to be delivered later.
Once the queue is shut down, no more messages are accepted for delivery.
Pending messages will be delivered to a consumer.

name: shutdown
description: Closes queue from accepting more messages for delivery

name: raiseSignal
description: Send a message containing an Error object. Iterator will throw an exception when processing this object

name: isSignal
description: Checks whether an object was created by raiseSginal method.

name: ./README.md
